thread.title: Ethiopia: ERC Takes Delivery of Trains As Ethio-Djibouti Project Nears Completion
thread.title_full: Ethiopia: ERC Takes Delivery of Trains As Ethio-Djibouti Project Nears Completion

title: Ethiopia: ERC Takes Delivery of Trains As Ethio-Djibouti Project Nears Completion
text:
Ethiopia: Gov't Readies 4 Billion Birr Aid for Drought Affected Areas Metals and Engineering Corporation manufactured 130 of the locomotives while the Chinese NORINCO Company the remaining 185. The Ethiopian Railway Corporation has taken delivery of 315 locomotives that carry passengers and freight along the Ethio-Djibouti railway. Some 1,171 trains are required to start full service on the Ethio-Djibouti railway line, said Dereje Tefera, Corporate Communication Affairs Head with the Corporation. Metals and Engineering Corporation manufactured 130 of the locomotives while the Chinese NORINCO Company the remaining 185. The new trains get power from both electric and diesel fuel, Dereje said. The project, which is being built in two directions - Sebeta-Measo, Measo-Diredawa-Dawele- is expected to be finalized the coming October. Two Chinese companies, China Railway Group (CREC) and China Civil Engineering Construction Corporation (CCECC) are undertaking the project. With the completion of track laying, project progress stands at 92 per cent, according to Dereje. The remaining task includes the installation of power lines and signal reception and communications equipment. The Ethio-Djibouti railway line stretches 656 kilometers inside the Ethiopian boarder while it spans only 100 kilometers inside the Djibouti boarder. The Ethiopian Railway Corporation plans to hand over administrative tasks to a foreign company. Ethiopia
